intro: Mentzelia scabra, commonly known as the rough mentzelia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, such as grasslands and rocky soils. The plant features slender, branching stems and small, lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine, stiff hairs. Its flowers are usually pale yellow or greenish-yellow, with five narrow lobes, and bloom in late spring to early summer. Mentzelia scabra is part of the Boraginaceae family and is known for its distinctive, rough texture and adaptability to harsh conditions.
